p: The samples were further divided into three groups according to various tissues, hormone treatments (MeJA, SA, and ABA), and abiotic stresses (heavy metal, salt, drought, cold, and wounding). Based on the M value, GeNorm identified β-TUB as the most stable reference gene for all samples, while ACT11 was identified as the most unstable (Fig. 1a). When considering different tissues and abiotic stress treatments, β-TUB was confirmed as the most appropriate gene, while α-TUB (Fig. 1b) and ACT11 (Fig. 1c) were confirmed as the least stable for different tissues and abiotic stress treatments, respectively. For hormone treatments, ACT7 was regarded as the most appropriate reference gene (Fig. 1d).
